review: This may well be the most disappointing piece of technology I've ever bought.  Thank god I only paid the $18 preorder, but even that was $20 too much.It's constantly having wifi connection problems, which is odd as my router is about 3 feet from the TV.When it is "working," it's really glitchy, buffers a lot, and has just flat-out stopped playback several times.  Sometimes it glitches longer than usual (like a half second) and makes a super loud chirp.  That's really fun.But it's really the constant "loading," "home not available," and bad connection messages that make me crazy.Lack of global search sucks, too.Oh, and the play button often doesn't work in Netflix.It's really just a poor experience.  I'm bummed, because I was really looking forward to this.  We watch a lot of Amazon Prime and rentals, so I like the top-level of Amazon in the UI, but man... The performance is killing me.  I'll be hooking the Roku back up.
author: Mikel Zwissler

review: I have 2 Roku 3's and a Chromecast. The Firestick isn't nearly as responsive as the Roku 3 but performs about the same as the Chromecast. For the money it's fine and since I primarily watch Amazon it was a good buy because it makes Amazon Video the center of attention. Hopefully they can push out an update that will make it a little snappier.
